definition: hopelessly muddled/impossible to unravel
old variant of 糾|纠[jiu1]
to gather together/to investigate/to entangle/to correct
to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy
(negative prefix)/not/no
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge

sentences.english: Eg. Mary didn't want to get involved in any perplexed relationship with a married man.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽不愿扯入与已婚男人纠缠不清的关系中。

sentences.english: Others became entangled in the debate.
sentences.chinese: 其他人在这场争论中纠缠不清。

sentences.english: Are your tables all tangled up?
sentences.chinese: 是你的表中的所有纠缠不清呢？

sentences.english: Talk people tend to fall into a non-trivial quarrel in the long-winded.
sentences.chinese: 议论别人往往陷入鸡毛蒜皮的是非口舌中纠缠不清。

sentences.english: Talking about others will make your trapped in ravelment by trifiles.
sentences.chinese: 议论别人往往陷入鸡毛蒜皮的是非口舌中纠缠不清。

sentences.english: Alcohol has a peculiar relationship to happiness.
sentences.chinese: 酒和幸福有着纠缠不清的关系。

sentences.english: And humans will be ever more intricately linked with their environment.
sentences.chinese: 人类与环境的联系会更加丝丝缕缕，纠缠不清。

definition: unclear/ambiguous/having an unclear relationship with
to be in a tangle/to nag
lit. lotus roots may break, but the fiber remains joined (idiom); lovers part, but still long for one another
entanglement/dispute
shady relationship/affair/adulterous relationship
connection/association/involvement
lit. two segments with a single cut (idiom)/fig. to make a clean break (idiom)
to tug at/to pull at sb aggressively/to take sb's hand or arm in a too familiar way/(derog.) to hobnob/to consort
ill-fated relationship
(coll.) to pester/to harass
lit. to stand with each foot in a different boat (idiom)/fig. to have it both ways/to run after two hares/(especially) to have two lovers at the same time
to have a foot in both camps/to have a bet each way/to be having an affair
triangle relationship/a love triangle
see 腳踏兩隻船|脚踏两只船[jiao3 ta4 liang3 zhi1 chuan2]
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
to have an acrimonious falling-out/to shed all pretense of cordiality/to tear into each other
